H0.text: Golden eagles are the largest living species of bird considered a raptor.

H1.text: California condor is the living species of bird considered the largest of the raptors.

H2.text: Peregrine falcon is the living species of bird considered the largest of the raptors.

H3.text: Pteradactyl is the largest living species of bird considered a raptor.

A4.text: Among raptorial birds that share the golden eagle's range, only some Old World vultures and the California condor are distinctly larger, with longer, broader wings, typically held more evenly in a slower, less forceful flight; they often have dramatically different colour patterns.
